  "title": "Email Marketer",
  "description": "Dekina Beauty is a pioneering beauty brand that instills confidence in natural beauty through innovation, intentionality, and emotional connection&mdash; empowering people to feel confident, authentic, and proud in their skin. At Dekina Beauty, we believe beauty isn&rsquo;t just about how you look &mdash; it&rsquo;s about how youfeelin your own skin.

Born from a passion to celebrate individuality, authenticity, and the quiet strength in nature, Dekina Beauty is more than a brand &mdash; it&rsquo;s a movement. We exist to help you reconnect with yourself, one drop, one swipe, one glow at a time.

We create&nbsp;intentionally formulated skincare&nbsp;powered by nature, backed by science, and designed to deliver results &mdash; but more importantly, to inspire confidence in your natural beauty. We are proof that gentle can still be effective, and minimal can still be powerful.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Email Marketer

Job Location:&nbsp;Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for planning, creating, and executing email campaigns that promote Dekina Beauty&rsquo;s products, offers, and seasonal collections.
	You&rsquo;ll craft compelling content that captures attention, builds trust, and drives conversionsfrom welcome emails to beauty tips, newsletters, and exclusive offers.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement email marketing strategies aligned with Dekina Beauty&rsquo;s brand voice and marketing goals.
	Write engaging, on-brand email copy and subject lines that improve open and click-through rates.
	Design and schedule email campaigns using tools like Mailchimp, Klaviyo, or similar platforms.
	Segment email lists to deliver personalized and targeted messages.
	Collaborate with the content, design, and social media teams to ensure consistent brand messaging across channels.
	Analyze email performance metrics (open rate, CTR, conversion, unsubscribe) and optimize campaigns accordingly.
	Conduct A/B tests on subject lines, copy, and visuals to maximize engagement.
	Manage customer retention and re-engagement campaigns.
	Stay updated on email marketing trends, automation tools, and best practices in the beauty industry.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor&rsquo;s Degree with 2 years of proven experience as an Email Marketing Specialist, preferably in the beauty, lifestyle, or fashion industry.
	Strong copywriting and storytelling skills with a flair for engaging, feminine, and persuasive language.
	Proficiency in email marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, Klaviyo, ConvertKit).
	Basic understanding of design tools (e.g., Canva, Figma) is a plus.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret metrics and drive strategy from data.
	Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality campaigns on time.
	A passion for beauty, skincare, and empowering women through confidence and self-care.


What We Offer


	Competitive pay and performance bonuses.
	Flexible working hours (remote-friendly).
	Opportunity to grow with a fast-rising beauty brand.
	A supportive, creative, and purpose-driven work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio (if available), and at least two sample email campaigns they&rsquo;ve created to:&nbsp;sales@dekinabeauty.com&nbsp;using&nbsp;&ldquo;Email Marketer Application &ndash; Dekina Beauty&rdquo; as the subject of the mail.",

Email Marketer Job at Dekina Beauty




        
    

        
        Dekina Beauty is a pioneering beauty brand that instills confidence in natural beauty through innovation, intentionality, and emotional connection— empowering people to feel confident, authentic, and proud in their skin. At Dekina Beauty, we believe beauty isn’t just about how you look — it’s about how youfeelin your own skin.

Born from a passion to celebrate individuality, authenticity, and the quiet strength in nature, Dekina Beauty is more than a brand — it’s a movement. We exist to help you reconnect with yourself, one drop, one swipe, one glow at a time.
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We create intentionally formulated skincare powered by nature, backed by science, and designed to deliver results — but more importantly, to inspire confidence in your natural beauty. We are proof that gentle can still be effective, and minimal can still be powerful.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Email Marketer

Job Location: Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	The Email Marketing Specialist will be responsible for planning, creating, and executing email campaigns that promote Dekina Beauty’s products, offers, and seasonal collections.
	You’ll craft compelling content that captures attention, builds trust, and drives conversionsfrom welcome emails to beauty tips, newsletters, and exclusive offers.


Key Responsibilities


	Develop and implement email marketing strategies aligned with Dekina Beauty’s brand voice and marketing goals.
	Write engaging, on-brand email copy and subject lines that improve open and click-through rates.
	Design and schedule email campaigns using tools like Mailchimp, Klaviyo, or similar platforms.
	Segment email lists to deliver personalized and targeted messages.
	Collaborate with the content, design, and social media teams to ensure consistent brand messaging across channels.
	Analyze email performance metrics (open rate, CTR, conversion, unsubscribe) and optimize campaigns accordingly.
	Conduct A/B tests on subject lines, copy, and visuals to maximize engagement.
	Manage customer retention and re-engagement campaigns.
	Stay updated on email marketing trends, automation tools, and best practices in the beauty industry.


Requirements


	Interested candidates should possess a Bachelor’s Degree with 2 years of proven experience as an Email Marketing Specialist, preferably in the beauty, lifestyle, or fashion industry.
	Strong copywriting and storytelling skills with a flair for engaging, feminine, and persuasive language.
	Proficiency in email marketing platforms (e.g., Mailchimp, Klaviyo, ConvertKit).
	Basic understanding of design tools (e.g., Canva, Figma) is a plus.
	Analytical mindset with the ability to interpret metrics and drive strategy from data.
	Attention to detail and commitment to delivering high-quality campaigns on time.
	A passion for beauty, skincare, and empowering women through confidence and self-care.


What We Offer


	Competitive pay and performance bonuses.
	Flexible working hours (remote-friendly).
	Opportunity to grow with a fast-rising beauty brand.
	A supportive, creative, and purpose-driven work environment.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV, portfolio (if available), and at least two sample email campaigns they’ve created to: sales@dekinabeauty.com using “Email Marketer Application – Dekina Beauty” as the subject of the mail.

At the core of our approach is a passionate team of designers who share a common vision: crafting timeless and beautiful designs that resonate with our clients, whether they are seeking to transform their residences or commercial spaces.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Officer
Job Location: Ojota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time
Industry: Furniture Manufacturing

Job Summary

	As the Procurement Officer, you are responsible for ensuring that the company acquires goods and services of the required quality, at the best possible price, and within the stipulated time frames.
	The role involves developing procurement strategies, identifying suppliers, evaluating bids, negotiating contracts, and maintaining supplier relationships.


Key Roles and Responsibilities


	Identify, evaluate, and develop relationships with suppliers and vendors specializing in furniture materials and interior design products.
	Negotiate contracts, pricing, and terms with suppliers to secure the best deals while maintaining quality.
	Collaborate with the projects, store and production teams to determine material requirements for upcoming projects.
	Develop procurement strategies and plans to meet project timelines and budget constraints.
	Analyze supplier quotations, pricing, and terms to ensure competitiveness and cost-effectiveness.
	Conduct regular cost analysis and market survey to identify cost-saving opportunities.
	Ensure all procured materials meet our stringent quality standards.
	Prepare and process purchase orders, ensuring accuracy and compliance with company policies and procedures.
	Monitor and track the status of orders to ensure on-time delivery.
	Maintain accurate procurement records, including purchase orders, invoices, and contracts.
	Ensure compliance with all relevant laws, regulations, and company policies in the procurement process.
	Stay updated on industry trends and best practices in procurement.
	Any other task as assigned by line manager.


Requirements


	Bachelor's Degree in Business Administration, Procurement, Supply Chain Management, or a related field.
	2 - 3 years of Knowledge of procurement policies and procedures, and experience in developing procurement strategies and implementing best practices.
	A higher Degree / Certificate is an added advantage
	Excellent negotiation and communication skills, with the ability to build and maintain strong relationships with suppliers and stakeholders.
	Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, with the ability to evaluate bids and proposals and make data-driven decisions.
	Proficiency in using procurement software and tools, including enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems.
	Strong attention to detail and organizational skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize work effectively.
	Strong negotiation and communication skills.
	Understanding of supplier risk management and the ability to assess and mitigate risks in the procurement process.
	Ability to work effectively as part of a team and collaborate with other departments to achieve common goals.
	Ability to work in a fast-paced environment.


Salary
N200,000 / Month.

Method of Application

Graduate Programme Manager Job at Union Maritime




        
    

        
        Union Maritime is at the forefront of the maritime industry, offering our customers cutting-edge transportation and logistics solutions. We constantly push the boundaries of what is possible, leveraging the latest technologies and industry best practices to deliver unparalleled efficiency and reliability. Whether it's our innovative approach to cargo handling or our use of data analytics to optimise routes and logistics, we are dedicated to staying ahead of the curve. At Union Maritime, we don't just meet the needs of our customers; we anticipate them. Join us on the cutting edge of maritime innovation and experience the Union Maritime difference.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Graduate Programme Manager
     

        



     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



Job Locations: Lagos
Employment type: Full time (Onsite)

Role overview


	Union Maritime is embarking on a transformative journey to secure its next generation of leaders, with the launch of a landmark graduate scheme in Lagos and the immediate parallel build-out of a globally consistent programme in Singapore.
	The Graduate Programme Manager will serve as architect and operational lead for this high-profile, cross-regional initiative. 
	This role is central to our long-term talent strategy, requiring strategic vision, rigorous execution, and the confidence to engage senior stakeholders and diverse partner networks. Immediate priorities include executing the Lagos scheme launch in December 2025, managing recruitment for a September 2026 cohort, and ensuring the Singapore programme is designed and delivered to run alongside Lagos, mirroring our high standards and unified global approach.


Role specification


	Lead the day-to-day delivery of the graduate programme across Lagos and Singapore, managing all logistics, communications, and learning activities.??
	Build and implement the parallel Singapore programme structure, ensuring complete alignment with the Lagos model and global standards.??
	Act as the central point of contact for graduates, line managers, the governance group, and other stakeholders.??
	Track progress, placements, and feedback; regularly report into HR and governance group, escalating risk or underperformance where needed.??
	Drive graduate recruitment activities (applications, assessment centres, interviews), starting December 2025/January 2026 for a September 2026 start.??
	Oversee four 6-month cross-business rotations per graduate, ensuring broad exposure and development.??
	Implement a robust stakeholder engagement, training, and communications plan across all regions.??
	Facilitate induction, onboarding, alumni activities, and continuous improvement initiatives.??
	Ensure each graduate is mentored, challenged, and supported, with clear performance management and regular review cycles.


Requirements


	Minimum 8 years of experience in HR, early careers, or graduate programme management, with direct responsibility for programme design, build-out, and delivery.
	Demonstrated expertise in project management for early career, graduate, or rotational talent initiatives.
	Preferably, experience managing large-scale programmes across multiple regions or in complex organisational environments.
	Proven ability to operate with high visibility, senior stakeholder engagement, and cross-regional coordination.??
	Strategic thinker, excellent communicator, and skilled at driving alignment across diverse teams.??
	Experience in the maritime sector or complex operational environment preferred, but not essential.??
	Personal qualities: ambitious, proactive, adaptable, and committed to building a world-class leadership pipeline.
	Role begins December 2025 (immediate onboarding and operational plan handover).
	Responsible for recruitment campaign launch in January 2026.
	Lead assessment centre delivery and candidate selection in February 2026.
	Oversee full onboarding and induction for September 2026 graduate intake.


Benefits


	This is an exceptional opportunity for a driven individual to join a leading global shipping company at a critical juncture in its growth.
	You will be part of a forward-thinking, dynamic team and have the chance to shape the future direction of the company's commercial strategy.
	At Union Maritime, we pride ourselves on fostering a supportive, collaborative environment where talent is nurtured, and personal and professional growth is encouraged.
	If you are looking for a challenging, fast-paced role with the potential to grow and develop within an industry-leading organisation, we want to hear from you.
